Description: Ostracon, large fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is partially black in section, the interior is covered with a dark-brown resinous substance, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and faint traces of four lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393255) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393255)
